definitions: the action or process of causing severe and irreparable damage or ruin to something
the state of being destroyed or severely damaged beyond repair or use
examples: The hurricane caused widespread destruction across the coastal region
Years of war brought complete destruction to the ancient city
The destruction of rainforests threatens global climate stability significantly
Witnessing the destruction of her life's work devastated her completely

definitions: a group of troops, aircraft, or ships sent on a separate mission
the state of being objective and emotionally uninvolved in a situation
the action or process of disconnecting or separating something from something else
examples: The naval detachment arrived at the port before dawn yesterday
A small detachment of soldiers guarded the embassy entrance carefully
His professional detachment helped him handle difficult cases objectively
She maintained emotional detachment throughout the painful divorce proceedings
The detachment of the retina required immediate surgical intervention
Complete detachment from worldly concerns characterized the monk's lifestyle

definitions: an individual feature, fact, or item considered separately from the whole
a temporary duty assignment of military personnel for a specific task
a small decorative feature or element in art, architecture, or design
examples: Every detail of the contract needs careful review before signing
She remembered every detail of their first meeting years ago
He was assigned to detail at the general's headquarters temporarily
The security detail protected the visiting diplomat throughout her stay
The architectural details on the cathedral facade are remarkably intricate
Close examination reveals exquisite detail in the miniature painting

definitions: the process of thoroughly cleaning and restoring a vehicle to pristine condition
the process of adding decorative or functional details to a design
the act of providing comprehensive information or specifications about something
examples: Professional detailing restored the vintage car to showroom condition
The auto detailing service includes waxing and interior shampooing
The architect spent weeks detailing the building's ornamental features
Careful detailing distinguishes luxury products from mass-produced items
The report's detailing of expenses helped identify budget overruns
Thorough detailing of procedures ensures consistent quality control standards

definitions: a person held in custody, especially for political reasons or pending investigation
someone detained by authorities without being formally charged with a crime
examples: The detainee was held for questioning about the security breach
Human rights groups demanded better treatment for political detainees worldwide
Immigration detainees awaited hearings in the overcrowded facility
The military detainee claimed he was denied access to legal counsel

definitions: the state or period of being held in official custody or confinement
the action of keeping someone in official custody, typically for questioning
examples: His detainment lasted seventy-two hours before charges were filed
The lawyer argued the detainment violated his client's constitutional rights
The detainment of protesters sparked international condemnation
Unlawful detainment can result in significant legal consequences for authorities

definitions: the process of discovering or identifying the presence of something hidden or unclear
the act of perceiving or noticing something through observation or measurement
examples: Detecting fraud requires sophisticated analytical software and trained personnel
Early detecting of diseases improves treatment outcomes significantly
The detecting of radiation levels happens continuously at nuclear facilities
Detecting subtle changes in behavior helps identify potential security threats

definitions: the action or process of identifying the presence of something concealed
the work of discovering and investigating crimes or gathering information
examples: Early cancer detection saves thousands of lives every year worldwide
The detection of counterfeit bills requires specialized training and equipment
Motion detection triggers the security system's alarm and cameras automatically
Virus detection software protects computers from malicious programs

definitions: a police officer whose job is investigating crimes and gathering evidence
a person employed privately to investigate and obtain information about others
examples: The detective interviewed all witnesses to reconstruct the crime scene
Senior detectives handle the department's most complex homicide cases
The private detective specialized in corporate espionage and fraud cases
She hired a detective to investigate her husband's suspicious activities

definitions: a device or instrument designed to discover the presence of something
a person whose job involves finding or discovering particular things or information
examples: The smoke detector's piercing alarm woke everyone in the building
Metal detectors at airports screen passengers for dangerous items
The lie detector analyzed physiological responses during questioning
Expert detectors can identify counterfeit artwork through subtle details

definitions: a punishment in which a student must stay at school after others have left
the action of detaining someone or the state of being detained in official custody
a facility where people are held in custody, especially immigrants or juveniles
examples: She received detention for talking during the mathematics examination
Saturday detention meant missing the important soccer match
His detention without trial violated international human rights laws
Pre-trial detention can last months in overcrowded facilities
The juvenile detention center offers educational and counseling programs
Immigration detention facilities face criticism for poor living conditions

definitions: a water-soluble cleansing agent that combines with impurities to make them more soluble
examples: The laundry detergent removes tough stains from colored fabrics effectively
Dish detergent cuts through grease on pots and pans quickly

definitions: the process of becoming progressively worse in quality, condition, or value
the physical breakdown or decay of materials, structures, or organic matter
examples: The patient's rapid deterioration concerned the medical team greatly
Economic deterioration forced many businesses to close permanently
Weather caused severe deterioration of the building's exterior walls
The deterioration of ancient manuscripts requires careful preservation efforts

definitions: a factor that decisively affects the nature or outcome of something
a quantity obtained from the elements of a square matrix according to specific rules
examples: Education level is a major determinant of lifetime earning potential
Social determinants of health include housing and food security
The determinant of this matrix equals zero, indicating linear dependence
Calculating determinants helps solve systems of linear equations efficiently

definitions: firmness of purpose and the quality of being resolute despite difficulties
the process of establishing exactly what something is or what causes it
examples: Her determination to succeed overcame every obstacle she faced
The team's determination led them to victory against stronger opponents
The determination of cause of death required extensive forensic analysis
Accurate determination of market value requires professional appraisal

definitions: the doctrine that all events are ultimately determined by causes external to human will
examples: Genetic determinism suggests behavior is primarily controlled by inherited traits
Economic determinism views material conditions as the primary force shaping society

definitions: the action of discouraging an action or event through instilling doubt or fear of consequences
examples: Nuclear deterrence prevented direct conflict between superpowers during the Cold War
Criminal deterrence relies on swift and certain punishment for lawbreaking

definitions: a thing that discourages or is intended to discourage someone from doing something
a weapon or system designed to prevent attack through fear of retaliation
examples: High prices serve as a deterrent to excessive consumption
Security cameras act as a deterrent against shoplifting and vandalism
The country's missile defense system serves as a strategic deterrent
Prison sentences are meant to be a deterrent to potential criminals

definitions: the action of causing a bomb or explosive device to explode
examples: The controlled detonation destroyed the old building within seconds
Premature detonation of the device injured several bomb disposal experts

definitions: a device or small explosive used to trigger a larger explosive device
examples: The bomb squad carefully removed the detonator from the suspicious package
Electronic detonators allow precise timing in demolition operations

definitions: a long or roundabout route taken to avoid something or visit somewhere along the way
a deviation from a direct course or the usual procedure
examples: Construction forced drivers to take a ten-mile detour through town
We made a detour to visit the famous waterfall
His career took an unexpected detour into television journalism
The conversation took a detour into personal matters

definitions: a process or period of time in which one abstains from unhealthy substances
medical treatment to remove drugs, alcohol, or toxins from the body
examples: The celebrity entered detox after years of substance abuse
A juice detox promises to cleanse your system in three days
Medical detox requires professional supervision for patient safety
The detox program combines therapy with nutritional support

definitions: the process of removing toxic substances or qualities from something
medical treatment for alcohol or drug addiction involving abstinence and cleansing
examples: Liver detoxification processes neutralize harmful chemicals in the bloodstream
Environmental detoxification of contaminated soil takes years to complete
The detoxification unit provides round-the-clock medical supervision for patients
Successful detoxification is the first step in addiction recovery treatment

definitions: the state of being harmed or damaged, especially in terms of loss or disadvantage
examples: Smoking causes serious detriment to your health over time
Working overtime to the detriment of family life creates problems

definitions: a tied score of 40-40 in tennis requiring one player to win two consecutive points
a playing card or die face showing two pips or spots
a tie or drawn position in various games or competitions
examples: The match went to deuce five times before she won
At deuce, the server needs two points to win the game
He drew the deuce of spades from the deck
Rolling a deuce with dice gives you two points
The teams reached deuce in the tiebreaker round
Another deuce meant the game would continue indefinitely

definitions: the reduction in the official value of a currency relative to other currencies
the reduction or underestimation of the worth or importance of something
examples: Currency devaluation made imports significantly more expensive overnight
The government's devaluation strategy aimed to boost export competitiveness
The devaluation of teaching as a profession affects recruitment
Cultural devaluation of manual labor creates social inequality

definitions: great destruction or damage, especially over a wide area
severe and overwhelming shock, distress, or grief
examples: The earthquake left devastation across three provinces
War brought complete devastation to the ancient city
The family struggled with devastation after losing their home
Personal devastation followed the unexpected diagnosis

definitions: a person who designs and builds software applications or systems
a person or company that builds houses or commercial properties for sale
a chemical solution used to make photographic images visible
examples: The software developer fixed bugs in the mobile application
Senior developers earn six-figure salaries at tech companies
The property developer plans to build luxury condominiums downtown
Real estate developers transformed the old warehouse district completely
The photographer mixed developer solution in the darkroom carefully
Fresh developer produces sharper photographic prints

definitions: the process of growing, changing, or becoming more advanced
the chemical treatment of photographic film to make images visible
examples: Developing countries need infrastructure investment for economic growth
The developing storm system threatens coastal areas with flooding
Developing film requires precise timing and temperature control
Digital photography eliminated the need for developing prints

definitions: the process of developing or being developed over a period of time
a new product, idea, or method that has been created or improved
an area of land with new buildings constructed on it
examples: Child development follows predictable stages from infancy through adolescence
Economic development requires investment in education and infrastructure
The latest development in cancer treatment shows promising results
This development could revolutionize renewable energy storage
The new housing development includes parks and shopping centers
Luxury developments along the waterfront attract wealthy buyers

definitions: behavior that violates social norms, rules, or expectations within a society
examples: Sociologists study deviance to understand social control mechanisms better
Cultural definitions of deviance vary significantly across different societies

definitions: a person whose behavior deviates from what is acceptable or normal
something that departs from usual or accepted standards
examples: Society often labels nonconformists as deviants unfairly
The study examined how deviants are treated within institutions
Statistical deviants in the data require further investigation
This deviant result suggests an error in measurement

definitions: a person whose behavior or beliefs differ from what is considered acceptable
a data point that differs significantly from other observations
examples: Social deviates often become innovators and change agents
The clinic treats sexual deviates with behavioral therapy
Remove statistical deviates before calculating the mean value
This deviate suggests measurement error or unusual conditions

definitions: the action of departing from an established course or accepted standard
the amount by which a single measurement differs from a fixed value
examples: Any deviation from safety protocols will result in termination
The slightest deviation from the flight path triggered alarms
Standard deviation measures the spread of data points
Calculate the deviation between predicted and actual values

definitions: a thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially mechanical or electronic
a technique used in art or literature to produce a particular effect
a plan, scheme, or trick with a particular aim
examples: The device monitors heart rate and blood pressure continuously
Modern devices connect wirelessly to share data instantly
The author uses flashback as a narrative device effectively
Metaphor is a powerful literary device for conveying meaning
The proposal was merely a device to gain time
His kindness was a device to win her trust

definitions: the supreme spirit of evil in Christian and Jewish belief
a very wicked or cruel person
something that is very difficult or annoying to deal with
examples: Medieval paintings often depicted the devil with horns and a tail
Some religions believe the devil tempts humans to sin
That landlord is a devil who evicts families without mercy
The child can be a little devil when he's tired
This printer is a devil to set up properly
Getting the stain out was the devil of a job

definitions: the act of planning or inventing something by careful thought
the process of creating or thinking up a scheme or method
examples: Devising effective marketing strategies requires market research and creativity
The team spent months devising a solution to the problem
Scientists are devising new methods to detect cancer earlier
Devising educational curricula demands understanding of child development

definitions: the transfer of power from central government to regional or local authorities
the supposed degeneration of a species or organism to a simpler form
examples: Scottish devolution created a separate parliament in Edinburgh
Political devolution gives regions more control over local affairs
Some incorrectly view devolution as evolution in reverse
The concept of devolution contradicts modern evolutionary theory

definitions: a person who is very interested in and enthusiastic about someone or something
a person who is devoted to a particular religion or religious practice
examples: Jazz devotees gathered for the annual music festival downtown
She's a devotee of organic farming and sustainable living
Hindu devotees make pilgrimages to sacred temples annually
The devotees chanted prayers throughout the night

definitions: love, loyalty, or enthusiasm for a person, activity, or cause
religious worship or observance
prayers or religious observances
examples: Her devotion to her family never wavered through difficult times
The nurse's devotion to patient care earned widespread respect
His devotion to Buddhism shaped his entire worldview
Religious devotion provides comfort during times of crisis
Morning devotions include scripture reading and meditation
The family gathered for evening devotions before bedtime

definitions: a short religious service or text for private worship
relating to religious worship or prayer
examples: She reads a daily devotional every morning before work
The bookstore sells devotionals for various Christian denominations
Devotional music filled the sanctuary during the service
His devotional practices include meditation and fasting

definitions: tiny drops of water that form on cool surfaces at night from atmospheric vapor
examples: Morning dew sparkled on the grass like tiny diamonds
Heavy dew soaked through her shoes during the walk

definitions: skill in performing tasks, especially with the hands
mental skill or quickness; cleverness
examples: The surgeon's dexterity saved the patient's life during surgery
Playing piano requires considerable manual dexterity
His mental dexterity helped him solve complex problems quickly
Political dexterity allowed her to navigate difficult negotiations

definitions: a group of metabolic disorders characterized by high blood sugar levels over time
examples: Type 2 diabetes affects millions of adults worldwide
Managing diabetes requires monitoring blood sugar levels regularly

definitions: a person who has diabetes
relating to or affected by diabetes
examples: The diabetic checks her blood sugar four times daily
Support groups help diabetics manage their condition effectively
Diabetic complications can affect eyes, kidneys, and nerves
The restaurant offers diabetic-friendly menu options

definitions: a jeweled crown or headband worn as a symbol of sovereignty
examples: The queen's diamond diadem sparkled under the palace lights
Ancient rulers wore diadems to symbolize their divine authority

definitions: the process of identifying a disease or condition from its symptoms
the process of analyzing the nature or cause of something
examples: Diagnosing rare diseases requires extensive testing and specialist knowledge
Early diagnosing of autism helps children receive appropriate support
Diagnosing computer problems involves systematic troubleshooting steps
The mechanic spent hours diagnosing the engine's unusual noise

definitions: a straight line joining two opposite corners of a square, rectangle, or other shape
a pattern or weave going diagonally across fabric
examples: Draw a diagonal from the top left to bottom right corner
The diagonal of the square measures fourteen inches exactly
The suit featured a subtle diagonal pattern in gray
Diagonal weaves create interesting texture in fabric designs

definitions: a simplified drawing showing the appearance, structure, or workings of something
examples: The diagram clearly shows how the engine components fit together
Students must label all parts on the anatomical diagram

definitions: a flat plate or disk with markings and a movable indicator for showing measurements
a control on a device that is turned to adjust or select something
examples: The watch dial displays Roman numerals in gold
The pressure gauge dial showed dangerous levels
Turn the dial clockwise to increase the temperature
She adjusted the radio dial to find her favorite station
